Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Maternal \Ma*ter"nal\, a. [F. maternel, L. maternus, fr. mater mother. See {Mother}.] Of or pertaining to a mother; becoming to a mother; motherly; as, maternal love; maternal tenderness. [1913 Webster]
Syn: See {Motherly}. [1913 Webster]

maternal adj 1: characteristic of a mother; "warm maternal affection for her guest"- Dorothy Sayers [ant: {paternal}] 2: relating to or derived from one's mother; "maternal genes" 3: relating to or characteristic of or befitting a parent; "parental guidance" [syn: {parental}, {paternal}] [ant: {filial}] 4: related on the mother's side; "my maternal grandmother" [syn: {enate}, {enatic}, {maternal(p)}]
